line_1: And knew your forms benignly grand, —
line_2: An awful but a lovely band;

line_1: The powerful billows, huge and grand,
line_2: More powerful is the powerful hand

line_1: (The Fair, the Rich, the Awful, and the Grand)
line_2: These grateful share the gift of Nature's hand;

line_1: But tho' not sweet, the scen'ry will be grand!
line_2: That roar when rigid winds become more bland —

line_1: There no more, in tourneys grand;
Adorned with forests, hills and mountains grand,
line_2: A vasty temple, paved with sea and land,

line_1: Where mountain peaks, and forests grand,
line_2: And also on the checkered land,

line_1: In this thy Temple, fair and grand,
In grace attempered majesty sublimely grand.
line_2: The high ranged columns own no mortal hand,

line_1: In grace attempered majesty sublimely grand.
line_2: Like polished snow the marble pillars stand

line_1: His pencil was striking, resistless and grand,
line_2: His manners were gentle, complying and bland;

line_1: Thy sky coped temple wide and grand,
line_2: On earth's vast space of sea and land —
